frontmatter.title: What Makes Good Purlins? 2- 9 Need-to-Know Facts Before Purchasing
frontmatter.subtitle: In architecture, structural engineering, or building, a purlin (or historically purline, purloyne, purling, perling) is a horizontal beam or bar used for structural support in buildings, most commonly in a roof. Purlins are supported either by rafters or the walls of the building. They are most frequently used in metal buildings, though they sometimes replace closely spaced rafters in wood-frame structures.

frontmatter.title: China cuts steel output as aims to reduce carbon emissions
frontmatter.subtitle: As China aims to meet goals to curb emissions, the country will cut crude steel output in 2021 and launched a nationwide investigation into the implementation of steel capacity cuts since 2016.

frontmatter.title: European coil market is constrained by shortages
frontmatter.subtitle: European HR coil prices are hitting record highs, both in the north and south of the continent. The average transaction value in the MEPS region for March was 753 Euro / ton. This compares with the highest figure of 791 Euro / tonne recorded in August 2008.

frontmatter.title: China: Steel prices & raw materials prices are falling rapidly
frontmatter.subtitle: China steel prices and steel material prices recently reversed to decline, after China loosened the policy of importing scrap steel. In the coming time, the world steel and steel material market will be affected by a number of conflicting factors. Accordingly, production costs are forecasted to increase, but China's steel material demand may not increase as much as last time.
